Technique: HEWN; PAINTED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB; SCULPTURED
Name: Shabti of Renseneb
Description: The shabti of Renseneb, a person who lived in the Middle Kingdom, more precisely during the reign of Sobekhotep IV, represents the mummiform owner wearing a blue wig. His arms are crossed across the chest and is holding a "hes"-vase in each hand.The hieroglyphic text, written on eight horizontal lines around the embalmed arms, is the precursor of Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead.
